meanings.definition: The quality of being excessively sentimental or emotional.
meanings.sent1: The sappiness of the movie made everyone cry.
meanings.sent2: Her sappiness was evident in the heartfelt letter she wrote.
meanings.sent3: The sappiness of the love song made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The sappiness of the poem flooded my heart with emotion.
meanings.sent5: His sappiness was so overwhelming that it touched everyone's hearts.

meanings.definition: The state of being overly sweet or cloying.
meanings.sent1: The sappiness of the dessert was too much for my taste.
meanings.sent2: The sappiness of the cake made it hard to finish.
meanings.sent3: The sappiness of the candy made my teeth ache.
meanings.sent4: The sappiness of the syrup made the pancakes too sugary.
meanings.sent5: The sappiness of the drink left a sticky residue on my lips.

meanings.definition: The tendency to evoke feelings of tenderness or nostalgia.
meanings.sent1: The sappiness of the old photograph brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The sappiness of the memory made him smile fondly.
meanings.sent3: The sappiness of the family reunion filled the room with warmth.
meanings.sent4: The sappiness of the story transported me back to my childhood.
meanings.sent5: The sappiness of the moment lingered in the air, comforting and familiar.
